_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Vibration Analysis on all Ammonia Compressors
_prev_prog_3.Description: Pioneer Frozen Foods has established an accident prevention program, which covers all operations associated with the ammonia refrigeration system subject to the RMP rule.  This program encompasses the facility's PSM program which is maintained by the Maintenance and Safety Manager.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Pioneer Frozen Foods, which is owned by C.H. Guenther & Son, Inc., operates a food manufacturing facility in Duncanville, Texas, that prepares and freezes baked goods for commercial use.  This site was initially owned by Texas Custom Bakers and was acquired by C.H. Guenther & Son, Inc. in 1987.

Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act applies to Pioneer Frozen Foods because the plant handles and stores anhydrous ammonia in excess of threshold quantities.  The ammonia refrigeration system at Pioneer Frozen Foods uses anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant in the freezers.  Two requirements of this section specifically apply to operations at the plant:

1.  Purpose and General Duty Clause - The essence of the general duty clause, 112(r)(1), is that an owner/operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has a fundamental obligation to ensure a safe operation and to have plans in place in the event of an accident to appropriately manage the situation.  Pioneer Frozen Foods is committed to the safe operation of their facility to ensure a safe workplace for our employees and a safe location for our neighbors in the community.  Pioneer Frozen Foods, therefore, has procedures in place to prevent accidents and is committed to emergency preparedness both for the plant and for the community by coordinating with the local fire department.
2.  Risk Management Plan - The ammonia refrigeration system at Pioneer Frozen Foods involves the handling and storage of one chemical, anhydrous ammonia, in excess of thresholds specified in 112(r). Even prior to the promulgation of 112(r), Pioneer Frozen Foods management has been very aware of the potential hazards posed by the handling and storage of anhydrous ammonia.  Programs have been established to prevent accidental releases and to train personnel for emergency response in the event of a release, including maintaining a trained medical emergency response team.  In addition to the above Clean Air Act requirements, Pioneer

potential hazards associated with Pioneer Frozen Foods operations and all steps being taken to prevent and mitigate accidents; and
-    Being a good corporate citizen of Dallas County.
    With these objectives in mind, this Risk Management Plan has been developed to provide information about Pioneer Frozen Foods' management of the risks associated with operating the ammonia refrigeration system at Pioneer Frozen Foods.  Most importantly, we stress our commitment to ensuring a safe operation for our employees, our visitors, and our community.
